DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure 50 Percent Greater Than Lowest PSA Lab Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for a PSA test result that is 50% greater than the nadir PSA test value for an individual.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure 50 Percent Greater Than Lowest PSA
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood or tissue for the lowest level of kallikrein-related sequence enzyme used as a biomarker for prostate cancer._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50_A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred)._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._In the lowest position, nearest the ground, at the bottom; minimal in magnitude, lowest in rank or importance; an extreme state of adversity._Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Integer::50 Percent Unit Greater Than Lowest PSA Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50:A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:In the lowest position, nearest the ground, at the bottom; minimal in magnitude, lowest in rank or importance; an extreme state of adversity.:Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
In the lowest position, nearest the ground, at the bottom; minimal in magnitude, lowest in rank or importance; an extreme state of adversity.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised relationship to EVS terminology.  **Laboratory Clean-Up**

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a PSA (prostate specific antigen) laboratory value.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
